docs.text: Welcome to Choco Choco is a high-level programming language, primarily intended for general use. It is designed to be a simple and convenient programming language for developers, borrowing syntax elements from Ruby, Go, and Rust! fn greet(name) { return "Hello, #{name}!"; } let greeting = greet("World"); puts greeting; Why Choose Choco? Easy to use : Simple, beautiful syntax that doesn't sacrifice readability or functionality Expressive : Write what you mean in a natural, readable way. Duck-based : If it looks like a duck and walks like a duck, then it must be a duck. Cross-Platform : Runs anywhere C/C++ runs. Getting Started Install Choco - Set up your enviroment. Quick Start Guide - Learn the basics

docs.text: Installation This guide will help you install Choco on your system. Right now, the only way of installing it is by cloning it in your system, you can either clone the GitHub repository using Git by doing: git clone https://github.com/mochacinno-dev/chocolang.git Or downloading it directly by: 1. Visiting the repository 2. Click the green "Code" button 3. Select "Download ZIP" 4. Extract the ZIP file to your desired location 5. Navigate to the extracted folder. Running Tourmaline Interactive Mode (REPL) Start the CocoaInterpreter: choco NOTE: This only works if choco.exe has been added to PATH Running Script Files Execute a Choco script file: choco <file>.choco !!! tip Choco only supports the .choco file extension.
